description:
People Ops is always looking to make the experience of work better and more meaningful for Googlers. But innovating (and operating!) is increasingly complex when Googlers work in more than 50 countries, each with its own unique practices and regulations. The Employee Engagement (EE) team works to make sure we not only do what’s required by law, but that we continue to raise the bar and do what’s right for Googlers all over the globe. From supporting LGBT rights to extending parental leave benefits, we aspire to do the right thing in every part of the world: to be fair and inclusive, disciplined yet not rigid, and consistent but not bureaucratic. As part of EE, the Retention, Progression and Equity team focuses on the fairness and equity of our talent systems. Our mission is to employ retention mechanisms, system interventions and accountability measures that increase equitable outcomes in our people processes as well as improve career progression and retention.

While it is the norm for companies to have HR teams focused on delivering talent processes, it is unique to have a team 100% dedicated to assessing the fairness and equity of those processes, and course correcting along the way. As the Retention, Progression and Equity team, we are pioneers in the industry with subject matter expertise, deep understanding of the unique experiences of diverse Googlers, and unwavering commitment to equity. We focus on accelerating diversity and inclusion and provide a unique lens for Google’s talent processes and systems, and address retention and progression while creating greater equity and fairness at Google.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants, and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them". We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously or projects involving cross-functional/team alignment.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to think holistically across existing talent processes and systems and to identify opportunities that both further individual careers and align with evolving systems.
  • Ability to influence stakeholders across multiple teams and levels.
  • Ability to juggle multiple complex competing priorities independently.
  • Deep understanding of diverse employee experience and knowledge in identifying and solving for cross-gender, -racial, power dynamics and commitment to growing knowledge base.
  • Strong communications and active listening skills; ability to tailor message to various audiences.
responsibilities:
• Contribute to strategy and design of the broader Case Management team through moving team towards common goals, changes, and/or objectives and developing support in systemic interventions in the org.
  • Coordinate day-to-day management of individual cases from beginning to close, including evaluating and understanding the situation, assessing appropriate approach, developing recommendations, and driving case forward.
  • Serve as a coach and advocate for Googlers, including and provide support, psychological safety, and intervention for complicated issues when necessary.
  • Identify potential cross-organization (People Ops) partnerships that increase a Googler’s opportunity for success and engage on driving those projects forward, e.g., onboarding for Googlers in a new role.
  • Cultivate partnerships with Internal Mobility, People Consultant, Diversity Business Partners, and other Employee Engagement teams to drive the best outcome.
title: Internal Community Advocate, YouTube
